Question
========

Suppose it is given that for a given patient population, the hemoglobin (Hb) level is normally distributed with μ = 13.4 and σ = 0.5. We randomly draw one person from this population. How high should the Hb of this person be at most to belong to the lowest 10% of the population? belong?

Answerlist
----------

* 12.5511
* 12.7592
* 13.3206
* 13.4732

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 12.5511: Incorrect
* 12.7592: Correct
* 13.3206: Incorrect
* 13.4732: Incorrect
